node.name: mpls
node.description: Anchor point for mpls configuration and operational dataNone

node.name: global
node.description: general mpls configuration applicable to any type of LSP and signaling protocol - label ranges, entropy label supportmay be added hereNone

node.name: config
node.description: Top level global MPLS configurationNone

node.name: null-label
node.description: The null-label type used, implicit or explicitNone

node.name: state
node.description: Top level global MPLS stateNone

node.name: null-label
node.description: The null-label type used, implicit or explicitNone

node.name: interface-attributes
node.description: Parameters related to MPLS interfacesNone

node.name: interface
node.description: List of TE interfacesNone

node.name: interface-id
node.description: Reference to the interface id list keyNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters related to MPLS interfaces:None

node.name: interface-id
node.description: Indentifier for the MPLS interfaceNone

node.name: mpls-enabled
node.description: Enable MPLS forwarding on this interfaceNone

node.name: state
node.description: State parameters related to TE interfacesNone

node.name: interface-id
node.description: Indentifier for the MPLS interfaceNone

node.name: mpls-enabled
node.description: Enable MPLS forwarding on this interfaceNone

node.name: interface-ref
node.description: Reference to an interface or subinterfaceNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configured reference to interface / subinterfaceNone

node.name: interface
node.description: Reference to a base interface. If a reference to a subinterface is required, this leaf must be specified to indicate the base interface.None

node.name: subinterface
node.description: Reference to a subinterface -- this requires the base interface to be specified using the interface leaf in this container. If only a reference to a base interface is requuired, this leaf should not be set.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state for interface-refNone

node.name: interface
node.description: Reference to a base interface. If a reference to a subinterface is required, this leaf must be specified to indicate the base interface.None

node.name: subinterface
node.description: Reference to a subinterface -- this requires the base interface to be specified using the interface leaf in this container. If only a reference to a base interface is requuired, this leaf should not be set.None

node.name: reserved-label-blocks
node.description: A range of labels starting with the start-label and up-to and including the end label that should be allocated as reserved. These labels should not be utilised by any dynamic label allocation on the local system unless the allocating protocol is explicitly configured to specify that allocation of labels should be out of the label block specified.None

node.name: reserved-label-block
node.description: A range of labels starting with the start-label up to and including the end label that should be allocated for use by a specific protocol.None

node.name: local-id
node.description: A reference to a unique local identifier for this label block.None

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters relating to the label block.None

node.name: local-id
node.description: A local identifier for the global label block allocation.None

node.name: lower-bound
node.description: Lower bound of the global label block. The block is defined to include this label.None

node.name: upper-bound
node.description: Upper bound for the global label block. The block is defined to include this label.None

node.name: state
node.description: State parameters relating to the label block.None

node.name: local-id
node.description: A local identifier for the global label block allocation.None

node.name: lower-bound
node.description: Lower bound of the global label block. The block is defined to include this label.None

node.name: upper-bound
node.description: Upper bound for the global label block. The block is defined to include this label.None

node.name: te-global-attributes
node.description: traffic-engineering global attributesNone

node.description: SRLG group identifierNone

node.name: value

node.name: cost

node.name: flooding-type
node.description: The type of SRLG, either flooded in the IGP or statically configuredNone

node.name: static-srlg-members
node.description: SRLG members for static (not flooded) SRLGs None

node.name: members-list
node.description: List of SRLG members, which are expressed as IP address endpoints of links contained in the SRLGNone

node.name: from-address
node.description: The from address of the link in the SRLGNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters relating to the SRLG membersNone

node.name: from-address
node.description: IP address of the a-side of the SRLG linkNone

node.name: to-address

node.name: to-address

node.name: mpls-admin-groups
node.description: Top-level container for admin-groups configuration and stateNone

node.name: admin-group
node.description: configuration of value to name mapping for mpls affinities/admin-groupsNone

node.name: admin-group-name
node.description: name for mpls admin-groupNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configurable items for admin-groupsNone

node.name: admin-group-name
node.description: name for mpls admin-groupNone

node.name: bit-position
node.description: bit-position value for mpls admin-group. The value for the admin group is an integer that represents one of the bit positions in the admin-group bitmask. Values between 0 and 31 are interpreted as the original limit of 32 admin groups. Values &gt=32 are interpreted as extended admin group values as per RFC7308.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state for admin-groupsNone

node.name: admin-group-name
node.description: name for mpls admin-groupNone

node.name: bit-position
node.description: bit-position value for mpls admin-group. The value for the admin group is an integer that represents one of the bit positions in the admin-group bitmask. Values between 0 and 31 are interpreted as the original limit of 32 admin groups. Values &gt=32 are interpreted as extended admin group values as per RFC7308.None

node.description: Definition for delays associated with setup and cleanup of TE LSPsNone

node.name: interface-ref
node.description: Reference to an interface or subinterfaceNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configured reference to interface / subinterfaceNone

node.name: interface
node.description: Reference to a base interface. If a reference to a subinterface is required, this leaf must be specified to indicate the base interface.None

node.name: subinterface
node.description: Reference to a subinterface -- this requires the base interface to be specified using the interface leaf in this container. If only a reference to a base interface is requuired, this leaf should not be set.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state for interface-refNone

node.name: interface
node.description: Reference to a base interface. If a reference to a subinterface is required, this leaf must be specified to indicate the base interface.None

node.name: subinterface
node.description: Reference to a subinterface -- this requires the base interface to be specified using the interface leaf in this container. If only a reference to a base interface is requuired, this leaf should not be set.None

node.name: igp-flooding-bandwidth
node.description: Interface bandwidth change percentages that trigger update events into the IGP traffic engineering database (TED)None

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters for TED update threshold None

node.name: threshold-type
node.description: The type of threshold that should be used to specify the values at which bandwidth is flooded. DELTA indicates that the local system should flood IGP updates when a change in reserved bandwidth &gt= the specified delta occurs on the interface. Where THRESHOLD_CROSSED is specified, the local system should trigger an update (and hence flood) the reserved bandwidth when the reserved bandwidth changes such that it crosses, or becomes equal to one of the threshold valuesNone

node.name: delta-percentage
node.description: The percentage of the maximum-reservable-bandwidth considered as the delta that results in an IGP update being floodedNone

node.name: threshold-specification
node.description: This value specifies whether a single set of threshold values should be used for both increasing and decreasing bandwidth when determining whether to trigger updated bandwidth values to be flooded in the IGP TE extensions. MIRRORED-UP-DOWN indicates that a single value (or set of values) should be used for both increasing and decreasing values, where SEPARATE-UP-DOWN specifies that the increasing and decreasing values will be separately specifiedNone

node.name: up-thresholds
node.description: The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum reservable bandwidth) at which bandwidth updates are to be triggered when the bandwidth is increasing.None

node.name: down-thresholds
node.description: The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum reservable bandwidth) at which bandwidth updates are to be triggered when the bandwidth is decreasing.None

node.name: up-down-thresholds
node.description: The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum reservable bandwidth of the interface) at which bandwidth updates are flooded - used both when the bandwidth is increasing and decreasingNone

node.name: state
node.description: State parameters for TED update threshold None

node.name: threshold-type
node.description: The type of threshold that should be used to specify the values at which bandwidth is flooded. DELTA indicates that the local system should flood IGP updates when a change in reserved bandwidth &gt= the specified delta occurs on the interface. Where THRESHOLD_CROSSED is specified, the local system should trigger an update (and hence flood) the reserved bandwidth when the reserved bandwidth changes such that it crosses, or becomes equal to one of the threshold valuesNone

node.name: delta-percentage
node.description: The percentage of the maximum-reservable-bandwidth considered as the delta that results in an IGP update being floodedNone

node.name: threshold-specification
node.description: This value specifies whether a single set of threshold values should be used for both increasing and decreasing bandwidth when determining whether to trigger updated bandwidth values to be flooded in the IGP TE extensions. MIRRORED-UP-DOWN indicates that a single value (or set of values) should be used for both increasing and decreasing values, where SEPARATE-UP-DOWN specifies that the increasing and decreasing values will be separately specifiedNone

node.name: up-thresholds
node.description: The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum reservable bandwidth) at which bandwidth updates are to be triggered when the bandwidth is increasing.None

node.name: down-thresholds
node.description: The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum reservable bandwidth) at which bandwidth updates are to be triggered when the bandwidth is decreasing.None

node.name: up-down-thresholds
node.description: The thresholds (expressed as a percentage of the maximum reservable bandwidth of the interface) at which bandwidth updates are flooded - used both when the bandwidth is increasing and decreasingNone

node.name: signaling-protocols
node.description: top-level signaling protocol configurationNone

node.name: rsvp-te
node.description: RSVP-TE global signaling protocol configurationNone

node.name: sessions
node.description: Enclosing container for sessionsNone

node.name: session
node.description: List of RSVP sessionsNone

node.name: local-index
node.description: Reference to the local index for the RSVP sessionNone

node.name: record-route-objects
node.description: Enclosing container for MPLS RRO objects associated with the traffic engineered tunnel.None

node.name: record-route-object
node.description: Read-only list of record route objects associated with the traffic engineered tunnel. Each entry in the list may contain a hop IP address, MPLS label allocated at the hop, and the flags associated with the entry.None

node.name: index
node.description: Reference to the index of the record route object. The index is used to indicate the ordering of hops in the path.None

node.name: state
node.description: Information related to RRO objects. The hop, label, and optional flags are present for each entry in the list.None

node.name: index
node.description: Index of object in the list. Used for ordering.None

node.name: address
node.description: IP router hop for RRO entryNone

node.name: reported-label
node.description: Label reported for RRO hopNone

node.name: reported-flags
node.description: Subobject flags for MPLS labelNone

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state parameters relating to the RSVP sessionNone

node.name: local-index
node.description: The index used to identify the RSVP session on the local network element. This index is generated by the device and is unique only to the local network element.None

node.name: source-address
node.description: Origin address of RSVP sessionNone

node.name: destination-address
node.description: Destination address of RSVP sessionNone

node.name: tunnel-id
node.description: The tunnel ID is an identifier used in the RSVP session, which remains constant over the life of the tunnel.None

node.name: lsp-id
node.description: The LSP ID distinguishes between two LSPs originated from the same headend, and is commonly used to distinguish RSVP sessions during make before break operations.None

node.name: session-name
node.description: The signaled name of this RSVP session.None

node.name: status
node.description: Enumeration of RSVP session statesNone

node.name: type
node.description: The type/role of the RSVP session, signifing the session's role on the current device, such as a transit session vs. an ingress session.None

node.name: protection-requested
node.description: The type of protection requested for the RSVP sessionNone

node.name: label-in
node.description: Incoming MPLS label associated with this RSVP sessionNone

node.name: label-out
node.description: Outgoing MPLS label associated with this RSVP sessionNone

node.name: sender-tspec
node.description: Operational state statistics relating to the SENDER_TSPEC received for the RSVP sessionNone

node.name: rate
node.description: The rate at which the head-end device generates traffic, expressed in bytes per second.None

node.name: size
node.description: The size of the token bucket that is used to determine the rate at which the head-end device generates traffic, expressed in bytes per second.None

node.name: peak-data-rate
node.description: The maximum traffic generation rate that the head-end device sends traffic at.None

node.name: neighbors
node.description: Configuration and state for RSVP neighbors connecting to the deviceNone

node.name: neighbor
node.description: List of RSVP neighbors of the local systemNone

node.name: address
node.description: Reference to the address of the RSVP neighborNone

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state parameters relating to the RSVP neighborNone

node.name: address
node.description: Address of RSVP neighborNone

node.name: detected-interface
node.description: Interface where RSVP neighbor was detectedNone

node.name: neighbor-status
node.description: Enumuration of possible RSVP neighbor statesNone

node.name: refresh-reduction
node.description: Suppport of neighbor for RSVP refresh reductionNone

node.description: Platform wide RSVP configuration and stateNone

node.name: bandwidth-reservations
node.description: Enclosing container for bandwidth reservationNone

node.name: bandwidth-reservation
node.description: Available and reserved bandwidth by priority on the interface.None

node.name: priority
node.description: Reference to the RSVP priority levelNone

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state parameters relating to a bandwidth reservation at a certain priorityNone

node.name: priority
node.description: RSVP priority level for LSPs traversing the interfaceNone

node.name: available-bandwidth
node.description: Bandwidth currently available with the priority level, or for the entire interface when the priority is set to ALLNone

node.name: reserved-bandwidth
node.description: Bandwidth currently reserved within the priority level, or the sum of all priority levels when the keyword is set to ALLNone

node.name: active-reservations-count
node.description: Number of active RSVP reservations in the associated priority, or the sum of all reservations when the priority level is set to ALLNone

node.name: highwater-mark
node.description: Maximum bandwidth reserved on the interface within the priority, or across all priorities in the case that the priority level is set to ALLNone

node.name: in-pkts
node.description: A cumulative counter of the packets received within the context which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment Identifier.None

node.name: in-octets
node.description: The cumulative counter of the total bytes received within the context which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment IdentifierNone

node.name: out-pkts
node.description: A cumulative counter of the total number of packets transmitted by the local system within the context which have a label imposed that corresponds to an Segment Identifier.None

node.name: out-octets
node.description: A cumulative counter of the total bytes transmitted by the local system within the context which have a label imported that corresponds to an SR Segment Identifier.None

node.name: interfaces
node.description: Interface related Segment Routing parameters.None

node.name: interface
node.description: Parameters and MPLS-specific configuration relating to Segment Routing on an interface.None

node.name: interface-id
node.description: A reference to the ID for the interface for which SR is configuredNone

node.name: config
node.description: MPLS-specific Segment Routing configuration parameters related to an interface.None

node.name: interface-id
node.description: A unique identifier for the interface.None

node.name: state
node.description: MPLS-specific Segment Routing operational state parameters related to an interface.None

node.name: interface-id
node.description: A unique identifier for the interface.None

node.description: A cumulative counter of the packets received within the context which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment Identifier.None

node.name: in-octets

node.name: out-pkts
node.description: A cumulative counter of the total number of packets transmitted by the local system within the context which have a label imposed that corresponds to an Segment Identifier.None

node.name: out-octets
node.description: A cumulative counter of the total bytes transmitted by the local system within the context which have a label imported that corresponds to an SR Segment Identifier.None

node.name: sid-counters
node.description: Per-SID statistics for MPLSNone

node.name: sid-counter
node.description: Per segment identifier counters for the MPLS dataplane.None

node.name: mpls-label
node.description: The MPLS label representing the segment identifierNone

node.name: state
node.description: State parameters for per-SID statisticsNone

node.name: mpls-label
node.description: The MPLS label used for the segment identifierNone

node.name: in-pkts
node.description: A cumulative counter of the packets received within the context which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment Identifier.None

node.name: in-octets
node.description: The cumulative counter of the total bytes received within the context which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment IdentifierNone

node.name: out-pkts
node.description: A cumulative counter of the total number of packets transmitted by the local system within the context which have a label imposed that corresponds to an Segment Identifier.None

node.name: out-octets
node.description: A cumulative counter of the total bytes transmitted by the local system within the context which have a label imported that corresponds to an SR Segment Identifier.None

node.name: forwarding-classes
node.description: Per-SID per-forwarding class counters for Segment Routing.None

node.name: forwarding-class
node.description: SID entries for the forwarding class associated with the referenced MPLS EXP.None

node.name: exp
node.description: Reference to the value of the EXP bits of the segment identifier.None

node.name: state
node.description: Per-SID, per forwarding class counters for Segment Routing with the MPLS dataplaneNone

node.name: exp
node.description: The value of the MPLS EXP (experimental) or Traffic Class bits that the SID statistics relate to. Packets received with a MPLS label value equal to the SID's MPLS label and EXP bits equal to the this value should be counted towards the associated ingress statistics. Packets that are forwarded to the destination MPLS label corresponding to the SID should be counted towards this value. In the egress direction, where forwarding follows a SID value that requires PHP at the local node, packets should still be counted towards the egress counters.None

node.name: in-pkts
node.description: A cumulative counter of the packets received within the context which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment Identifier.None

node.name: in-octets
node.description: The cumulative counter of the total bytes received within the context which have matched a label corresponding to an SR Segment IdentifierNone

node.name: out-pkts
node.description: A cumulative counter of the total number of packets transmitted by the local system within the context which have a label imposed that corresponds to an Segment Identifier.None

node.name: out-octets
node.description: A cumulative counter of the total bytes transmitted by the local system within the context which have a label imported that corresponds to an SR Segment Identifier.None

node.name: interface-ref
node.description: Reference to an interface or subinterfaceNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configured reference to interface / subinterfaceNone

node.name: interface
node.description: Reference to a base interface. If a reference to a subinterface is required, this leaf must be specified to indicate the base interface.None

node.name: subinterface
node.description: Reference to a subinterface -- this requires the base interface to be specified using the interface leaf in this container. If only a reference to a base interface is requuired, this leaf should not be set.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state for interface-refNone

node.name: interface
node.description: Reference to a base interface. If a reference to a subinterface is required, this leaf must be specified to indicate the base interface.None

node.name: subinterface
node.description: Reference to a subinterface -- this requires the base interface to be specified using the interface leaf in this container. If only a reference to a base interface is requuired, this leaf should not be set.None

node.name: lsps
node.description: LSP definitions and configurationNone

node.name: constrained-path
node.description: traffic-engineered LSPs supporting different path computation and signaling methodsNone

node.name: named-explicit-paths
node.description: Enclosing container for the named explicit pathsNone

node.name: named-explicit-path
node.description: A list of explicit pathsNone

node.name: name
node.description: A string name that uniquely identifies an explicit pathNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters relating to named explicit pathsNone

node.name: name
node.description: A string name that uniquely identifies an explicit pathNone

node.name: sid-selection-mode
node.description: The restrictions placed on the SIDs to be selected by the calculation method for the explicit path when it is instantiated for a SR-TE LSPNone

node.name: sid-protection-required
node.description: When this value is set to true, only SIDs that are protected are to be selected by the calculating method when the explicit path is instantiated by a SR-TE LSP.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state parameters relating to the named explicit pathsNone

node.name: name
node.description: A string name that uniquely identifies an explicit pathNone

node.name: sid-selection-mode
node.description: The restrictions placed on the SIDs to be selected by the calculation method for the explicit path when it is instantiated for a SR-TE LSPNone

node.name: sid-protection-required
node.description: When this value is set to true, only SIDs that are protected are to be selected by the calculating method when the explicit path is instantiated by a SR-TE LSP.None

node.name: explicit-route-objects
node.description: Enclosing container for EROsNone

node.name: explicit-route-object
node.description: List of explicit route objectsNone

node.name: index
node.description: Index of this explicit route object, to express the order of hops in pathNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters relating to an explicit routeNone

node.name: address
node.description: router hop for the LSP pathNone

node.name: hop-type
node.description: strict or loose hopNone

node.name: index
node.description: Index of this explicit route object to express the order of hops in the pathNone

node.name: state
node.description: State parameters relating to an explicit routeNone

node.name: address
node.description: router hop for the LSP pathNone

node.name: hop-type
node.description: strict or loose hopNone

node.name: index
node.description: Index of this explicit route object to express the order of hops in the pathNone

node.name: tunnels
node.description: Enclosing container for tunnelsNone

node.name: tunnel
node.description: List of TE tunnels. This list contains only the LSPs that the current device originates (i.e., for which it is the head-end). Where the signaling protocol utilised for an LSP allows a mid-point or tail device to be aware of the LSP (e.g., RSVP-TE), then the associated sessions are maintained per protocolNone

node.name: name
node.description: The tunnel nameNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters related to TE tunnels:None

node.name: name
node.description: The tunnel nameNone

node.name: type
node.description: Tunnel type, p2p or p2mpNone

node.name: signaling-protocol
node.description: Signaling protocol used to set up this tunnelNone

node.name: description
node.description: optional text description for the tunnelNone

node.name: admin-status
node.description: TE tunnel administrative state.None

node.name: preference
node.description: Specifies a preference for this tunnel. A lower number signifies a better preferenceNone

node.name: metric-type
node.description: The type of metric specification that should be used to set the LSP(s) metricNone

node.name: metric
node.description: The value of the metric that should be specified. The value supplied in this leaf is used in conjunction with the metric type to determine the value of the metric used by the system. Where the metric-type is set to LSP_METRIC_ABSOLUTE - the value of this leaf is used directly; where it is set to LSP_METRIC_RELATIVE, the relevant (positive or negative) offset is used to formulate the metric; where metric-type is LSP_METRIC_INHERITED, the value of this leaf is not utilisedNone

node.name: shortcut-eligible
node.description: Whether this LSP is considered to be eligible for us as a shortcut in the IGP. In the case that this leaf is set to true, the IGP SPF calculation uses the metric specified to determine whether traffic should be carried over this LSPNone

node.name: protection-style-requested
node.description: style of mpls frr protection desired: can be link, link-node or unprotected.None

node.name: reoptimize-timer
node.description: frequency of reoptimization of a traffic engineered LSPNone

node.name: source
node.description: RSVP-TE tunnel source addressNone

node.name: soft-preemption
node.description: Enables RSVP soft-preemption on this LSPNone

node.name: setup-priority
node.description: RSVP-TE preemption priority during LSP setup, lower is higher priority; default 7 indicates that LSP will not preempt established LSPs during setupNone

node.name: hold-priority
node.description: preemption priority once the LSP is established, lower is higher priority; default 0 indicates other LSPs will not preempt the LSPs once establishedNone

node.name: state
node.description: State parameters related to TE tunnelsNone

node.name: role
node.description: The lsp role at the current node, whether it is headend, transit or tailend.None

node.name: counters
node.description: State data for MPLS label switched paths. This state data is specific to a single label switched path.None

node.name: bytes
node.description: Number of bytes that have been forwarded over the label switched path.None

node.name: packets
node.description: Number of pacets that have been forwarded over the label switched path.None

node.name: path-changes
node.description: Number of path changes for the label switched pathNone

node.name: state-changes
node.description: Number of state changes for the label switched pathNone

node.name: online-time
node.description: Indication of the time the label switched path transitioned to an Oper Up or in-service stateNone

node.name: current-path-time
node.description: Indicates the time the LSP switched onto its current path. This is reset upon a LSP path change.None

node.name: next-reoptimization-time
node.description: Indicates the next scheduled time the LSP will be reoptimized.None

node.name: bandwidth
node.description: Bandwidth configuration for TE LSPsNone

node.description: Configuration parameters related to bandwidth on TE tunnels:None

node.name: specification-type
node.description: The method used for settign the bandwidth, either explicitly specified or configuredNone

node.name: set-bandwidth
node.description: set bandwidth explicitly, e.g., using offline calculationNone

node.name: state
node.description: State parameters related to bandwidth configuration of TE tunnelsNone

node.name: specification-type
node.description: The method used for settign the bandwidth, either explicitly specified or configuredNone

node.name: set-bandwidth
node.description: set bandwidth explicitly, e.g., using offline calculationNone

node.name: signaled-bandwidth
node.description: The currently signaled bandwidth of the LSP. In the case where the bandwidth is specified explicitly, then this will match the value of the set-bandwidth leaf; in cases where the bandwidth is dynamically computed by the system, the current value of the bandwidth should be reflected.None

node.name: auto-bandwidth
node.description: Parameters related to auto-bandwidthNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters relating to MPLS auto-bandwidth on the tunnel.None

node.name: enabled
node.description: enables mpls auto-bandwidth on the lspNone

node.name: min-bw
node.description: set the minimum bandwidth in Kbps for an auto-bandwidth LSPNone

node.name: max-bw
node.description: set the maximum bandwidth in Kbps for an auto-bandwidth LSPNone

node.name: adjust-interval
node.description: time in seconds between adjustments to LSP bandwidthNone

node.name: adjust-threshold
node.description: percentage difference between the LSP's specified bandwidth and its current bandwidth allocation -- if the difference is greater than the specified percentage, auto-bandwidth adjustment is triggeredNone

node.name: associated-rsvp-session
node.description: If the signalling protocol specified for this path is RSVP-TE, this leaf provides a reference to the associated session within the RSVP-TE protocol sessions list, such that details of the signaling can be retrieved.None

node.name: candidate-secondary-paths
node.description: The set of candidate secondary paths which may be used for this primary path. When secondary paths are specified in the list the path of the secondary LSP in use must be restricted to those path options referenced. The priority of the secondary paths is specified within the list. Higher priority values are less preferred - that is to say that a path with priority 0 is the most preferred path. In the case that the list is empty, any secondary path option may be utilised when the current primary path is in use.None

node.name: candidate-secondary-path
node.description: List of secondary paths which may be utilised when the current primary path is in useNone

node.name: secondary-path
node.description: A reference to the secondary path option reference which acts as the key of the candidate-secondary-path listNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters relating to the candidate secondary pathNone

node.name: secondary-path
node.description: A reference to the secondary path that should be utilised when the containing primary path option is in useNone

node.name: priority
node.description: The priority of the specified secondary path option. Higher priority options are less preferable - such that a secondary path reference with a priority of 0 is the most preferredNone

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state parameters relating to the candidate secondary pathNone

node.name: secondary-path
node.description: A reference to the secondary path that should be utilised when the containing primary path option is in useNone

node.name: priority
node.description: The priority of the specified secondary path option. Higher priority options are less preferable - such that a secondary path reference with a priority of 0 is the most preferredNone

node.name: active
node.description: Indicates the current active path option that has been selected of the candidate secondary pathsNone
